title: Method and apparatus for combining gene predictions using bayesian networks
abstract: Computer based apparatus and method automates gene prediction in a subject genomic sequence. A plurality of expert systems provide preliminary or intermediate gene predictions. A Bayesian network combiner combines the intermediate gene predictions and forms a final gene prediction. The final gene prediction accounts for dependencies between individual expert systems and dependencies between adjacent parts of the subject genomic sequence.
claims:
1. Computer apparatus for gene prediction comprising:
a plurality of units for predicting gene locations in a subject genomic sequence, each unit providing respective intermediate indications of gene locations output by the unit;
a combiner coupled to each unit to receive the respective intermediate output indications of predicted gene locations, the combiner being formed of a Bayesian network which combines the predicted gene locations using probabilities of gene locations of the subject genomic sequence, and forming a final combined output for indicating predicted genes of the subject genomic sequence.
2. Computer apparatus as claimed in claim 1 wherein the plurality of units is a plurality of expert systems.
3. Computer apparatus as claimed in claim 1 wherein the Bayesian network accounts for dependencies between individual units and dependencies between adjacent parts of the subject genomic sequence.
